channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: Logseq raises $4.1M to Accelerate Growth of the New World Knowledge Graph. https://t.co/qloTshFyUp

The court is a contradiction. 1. They are above the political fray, they make the right decision no matter how unfair or disruptive. 2. At the same time, they make decisions based on whether something is deeply rooted in society. Which is it? Can't be both.

Popping up every time there's a crisis, emitting rage on social media, is no answer. We got into this hole by not understanding the implications of our actions while the other side was working slowly and surely for 30+ years to get to this place.
How many people who will be enraged over the abortion decision, didn't vote for HRC in 2017 because they didn't trust her.
This would not be happening if a few more people came out to vote on election day in 2016.
To Democratic marketers (I hope there are some) -- it's time to introduce a new actor to American politics -- The Federalist Society. Treat it like the right treats Sharia Law or Critical Race Theory, only of course the FS is real. And the conspiracy is real. It's how we got here
I heard Biden on the radio this morning talking about MAGA being behind this. That's not useful and it's not true. The MAGA people will really be hurt by this. Now is a good time Mr President, to try to unite us.
This is the real Anti-People Republican Party.
This is the 1%. The Federalist Society. It's a plot to rob us of our rights. To turn America into a religious dictatorship.
Mr President here's your chance to be transformative. But first you need to learn how to talk about it.
One more thing -- forget bipartisanship. It's so totally not happening. There can't be any compromise on this, so this is a war to the end. No more Republicans.

Over 60 million Americans have taxes so simple the IRS could do them automatically. https://t.co/eYStzuwWJr
The 17 Most Beautiful Brutalist Buildings in the World. https://t.co/nXxsIMFrhv
Death row inmate‚Äôs dreadful dilemma: lethal drugs or cyanide used by Nazis. https://t.co/N2N5zBXOnm

Is abortion ‚Äúdeeply rooted in this Nation‚Äôs history and tradition?‚Äù Among people alive today, most of whom have lived their whole adult lives in a country where abortion was always constitutionally protected, yes it is very much deeply rooted.
@ScruggsDJ Heh that‚Äôs weird. He‚Äôs a guitarist. I asked what was my name. It said David. I asked what is my last name, and she told me about someone with Hodgkin lymphoma.
Why Do Ski Resorts Close When Their Snowpack is Still So Deep? https://t.co/atO8IAB3pZ
@laurajmansfield That's good. Take your time! ;-)
Celebrities at the Airport - Photos of 1970s Celebs. https://t.co/12odr6hU8e

@jeffjarvis @bluesky Software takes time. Replicating the functionality of a system that‚Äôs huge in complexity and scale while changing its underlying design, think about any other field, imagine rebuilding the nyc subway in a year or two with one of the basic constraints changed.
@jeffjarvis @bluesky People expect miracles of software mostly because they don‚Äôt understand how it‚Äôs made but it‚Äôs pretty much like everything else, if it took a long time to make it the first time it‚Äôs going to take almost as much time the second and that‚Äôs assuming you‚Äôre cloning it.
I don‚Äôt envy the bluesky people. Everyone is watching with great expectation and they‚Äôve bit off the problem of federating a closed system that has been built over sixteen years.
I‚Äôve been programming for 49 years.
December 2021: My product is interop. https://t.co/yYkHcrwgNf
I just solved @washingtonpost's crossword. https://t.co/5Q1xCSALtm
Of Course the Constitution Has Nothing to Say About Abortion (it makes no mention of women). https://t.co/a0lQpxV5AF

@arimelber -- you should have @ElieNYC as a special guest to do a rendition on his chapter in this latest book about abortion. His book is a master class, the chapter on abortion is the best explanation of the issues I've heard. Opened my eyes and mind.
@tconfrey @bmann @blaine OPML has been around since the late 90s. It's not a newcomer pretending to unify all previous formats. We were making lots of outlines, so we needed a format for interop.

@tconfrey @bmann @blaine I'm very interested in interop between outliners. https://t.co/yYkHcrwgNf OPML is a widely supported format. I understand you prefer another format. Please concisely tell us more about it. Some example files would help. Is there a spec?
@wmf what do you think?
It‚Äôs Time to Rage. https://t.co/IlStF7CHRE
